meanings.definition: To smear or daub with something sticky or dirty.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally gaumed her hands with paint while working on her art project.
meanings.sent2: The toddler managed to gaum peanut butter all over the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy gaumed mud all over the freshly cleaned floor.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to gaum colors together in a beautiful blend on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The sticky dough began to gaum to the rolling pin as she tried to flatten it.

meanings.sent1: There was a strange gaum on the bottom of his shoe after walking through the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The old book had a thick layer of gaum on its cover from years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they played with the slimy gaum they found in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The swamp was covered in a thick gaum that made it difficult to navigate through.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic wiped the greasy gaum off his hands after fixing the car engine.
